Name: Resilient Manufacturing
Description: Decentralized, open-source manufacturing systems including robotics, 3D printing, and assistive technology. Reduces supply chain vulnerabilities and enables local production capabilities.
Key Implementations: k-scale, SalvageGarden, Simula, FarmHack, Open Source Ecology
Key Institutional Players: Fab Foundation, Maker Movement, RepRap Project
Regulatory Context: Product safety standards, manufacturing compliance varies by jurisdiction
Required Primitives: CAD/CAM sharing protocols, decentralized supply coordination

Name: Open Source Hardware & Silicon
Description: Open-source hardware, silicon, and mobile operating systems that reduce dependence on centralized manufacturers. Enables hardware-level privacy and security without corporate gatekeeping.
Key Implementations: GrapheneOS, Freedom Factory (ethOS), Nanographs, Open Silicon Initiatives, RISC-V
Key Institutional Players: RISC-V Foundation, Linux Foundation, Mozilla, Open Compute Project
Regulatory Context: Export controls on semiconductors, open source licensing frameworks
Required Primitives: Formal verification, secure boot, hardware attestation

Name: Biodefense & Health Systems
Description: Technologies protecting human health through decentralized pathogen surveillance, open-source medical devices, and resilient healthcare infrastructure. Core d/acc domain for defending against biological threats.
Key Implementations: Varro Inc., Pathoplexus, OSLUV, Openwater, MediLedger
Regulatory Context: FDA medical device pathways, CDC surveillance partnerships, WHO pandemic preparedness
Required Primitives: Secure data sharing, privacy-preserving computation, decentralized storage

Name: Decentralized Energy
Description: Peer-to-peer energy trading, decentralized grid management, and renewable energy coordination without centralized utilities. Enables energy sovereignty and resilience.
Key Implementations: Power Ledger, Energy Web Foundation, LO3 Energy, WePower
Key Institutional Players: Energy Web Foundation, Rocky Mountain Institute, IEA
Regulatory Context: Utility regulations vary by jurisdiction, net metering policies, grid interconnection rules
Required Primitives: Oracles for energy data, smart contracts for trading, IoT integration

Name: Civic Tech
Description: Community-driven technology for civic engagement, urban farming, maker spaces, and local coordination. Grassroots d/acc applications.
Key Implementations: http://Better.SG, Edible Garden City, Soil Social, Chiang Mai Maker Club
Key Institutional Players: Code for America, mySociety, Civic Tech communities
Regulatory Context: Varies by application, generally light-touch regulation
Required Primitives: Local coordination tools, community governance, resource sharing

Name: Carbon & Environmental Markets
Description: On-chain carbon credits, environmental tokenization, and decentralized climate markets. Enables transparent and tradeable environmental assets.
Key Implementations: Toucan Protocol, KlimaDAO, Verra (centralization concern)
Key Institutional Players: Gold Standard, Verra, Climate Action Reserve
Regulatory Context: Voluntary carbon market standards, Article 6 of Paris Agreement
Required Primitives: Oracles for verification, tokenization standards, MRV systems

Name: Privacy-Preserving Computation
Description: Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE), Multi-Party Computation (MPC), and secure enclaves enabling computation on encrypted data without decryption.
Key Implementations: Zama (FHE), ZenGo (MPC), Fireblocks, Inco Network
Key Institutional Players: DARPA, Microsoft Research, Intel SGX, a16z
Regulatory Context: Favorable for GDPR compliance, healthcare privacy, financial confidentiality
Required Primitives: FHE libraries, MPC protocols, trusted execution environments

Name: Zero-Knowledge Systems
Description: Zero-knowledge proof infrastructure enabling verification without revealing underlying data. Core d/acc primitive for privacy-preserving computation and scaling.
Key Implementations: Aztec Network, zkSync, StarkNet, Polygon, Scroll, Taceo
Key Institutional Players: Ethereum Foundation, a16z, Paradigm, Protocol Labs
Projects: Aztec Network (https://www.notion.so/Aztec-Network-2fc06d2570f2819c9de0de7003ebb968?pvs=21), zkSync (https://www.notion.so/zkSync-2fc06d2570f2814da95fca57117890aa?pvs=21), StarkNet (https://www.notion.so/StarkNet-2fc06d2570f281d2871fe51a91f2e32c?pvs=21), Polygon (https://www.notion.so/Polygon-2fc06d2570f28129b770dab57a24cf00?pvs=21), Scroll (https://www.notion.so/Scroll-2fc06d2570f281ce9917f4216c3f6c34?pvs=21), Phala Network (https://www.notion.so/Phala-Network-2ff06d2570f281d1a101ea8df1db0a5f?pvs=21)
Regulatory Context: Privacy regulations (GDPR) may favor ZK, sanctions compliance discussions ongoing
Required Primitives: Cryptographic primitives, proving systems, verifier contracts

Name: Decentralized Identity & Attestation
Description: Self-sovereign identity, verifiable credentials, and attestation systems. Enables users to control their digital identity without centralized authorities.
Key Implementations: ENS, Worldcoin, Polygon ID, EAS, Gitcoin Passport, QuarkID
Key Institutional Players: W3C, DIF, Ethereum Foundation, governments (Buenos Aires)
Projects: ENS (https://www.notion.so/ENS-2fc06d2570f2811a9db2f8b53aad393b?pvs=21), Worldcoin (https://www.notion.so/Worldcoin-2fc06d2570f281418d9efc157773ea4c?pvs=21), EAS (https://www.notion.so/EAS-2fc06d2570f28169b259f8f2564f4943?pvs=21), Polygon ID (https://www.notion.so/Polygon-ID-2fc06d2570f28160ae0edb291f796310?pvs=21), Gitcoin Passport (https://www.notion.so/Gitcoin-Passport-2fc06d2570f281d0b290e80170a6f055?pvs=21)
Regulatory Context: eIDAS 2.0 in EU, digital ID frameworks emerging globally
Required Primitives: DID standards, verifiable credentials, ZK attestations

Name: Formal Verification & Security
Description: Smart contract auditing, formal verification, bug bounties, and security tooling. Essential infrastructure for ensuring d/acc systems are secure.
Key Implementations: Trail of Bits, OpenZeppelin, Spearbit, Immunefi, Code4rena
Key Institutional Players: Ethereum Foundation, major protocols, security researchers
Projects: OpenZeppelin (https://www.notion.so/OpenZeppelin-2fc06d2570f281f2addef937ddfc1379?pvs=21), Immunefi (https://www.notion.so/Immunefi-2fc06d2570f2818d9bacd0051597b63d?pvs=21), Trail of Bits (https://www.notion.so/Trail-of-Bits-2fc06d2570f281c3bfd4e8b6a91e2645?pvs=21), Code4rena (https://www.notion.so/Code4rena-2fc06d2570f2816b8fcbf199ae458ad0?pvs=21), Spearbit (https://www.notion.so/Spearbit-2fc06d2570f281cf8ba5ca45e8d1e523?pvs=21)
Regulatory Context: Emerging smart contract audit standards, liability frameworks developing
Required Primitives: Formal verification tools, static analysis, runtime monitoring

Name: Secrets-as-a-Service
Description: Programmable access control and secrets management layers. Determines WHO can access WHAT data WHEN, distinct from encryption layer.
Key Implementations: Mysten Labs (Sui), Lit Protocol, Privy
Regulatory Context: Key management compliance, enterprise security standards
Required Primitives: Threshold cryptography, access control lists, key derivation

Name: Communication & Messaging
Description: End-to-end encrypted, decentralized messaging and communication protocols. Enables private communication without centralized intermediaries.
Key Implementations: XMTP Labs, HOPR, Waku, Status, Session
Key Institutional Players: Signal Foundation, Protocol Labs, Status Network
Regulatory Context: Encryption debates ongoing, backdoor mandates in some jurisdictions
Required Primitives: E2E encryption, metadata protection, decentralized routing

Name: Governance Tooling
Description: DAO governance frameworks, voting systems, and collective decision-making tools. Enables coordination without centralized authorities.
Key Implementations: Safe, Argent, Aragon, Compound Governor, Tally, Snapshot
Projects: Safe (https://www.notion.so/Safe-2fc06d2570f28130bc44c783f0a96a19?pvs=21), Snapshot (https://www.notion.so/Snapshot-2fc06d2570f281a18718ee86b4a680a5?pvs=21), Argent (https://www.notion.so/Argent-2fc06d2570f281dc9b14c38739383ef7?pvs=21), Aragon (https://www.notion.so/Aragon-2fc06d2570f2814296b0edb2d382078d?pvs=21), Compound Governor (https://www.notion.so/Compound-Governor-2fc06d2570f281838188ea5457080888?pvs=21), Tally (https://www.notion.so/Tally-2fc06d2570f281e193cbdee610ad2821?pvs=21)
Regulatory Context: DAO legal frameworks emerging (Wyoming, Marshall Islands), securities considerations

Name: Decentralized Monetary Infrastructure
Description: Decentralized stablecoins and monetary systems without central bank control.
Key Implementations: DAI, Circles/CirclesUBI, Ethena
Regulatory Context: Stablecoin regulations emerging globally, MiCA in EU

Name: Epistemic Infrastructure
Description: Prediction markets, fact-checking systems, and tools for improving collective epistemics. Combats misinformation through decentralized truth-finding.
Key Implementations: Metaculus, Polymarket, CheckMateSG, Deepsafe
Key Institutional Players: Good Judgment Project, forecasting community, media orgs
Regulatory Context: Gambling regulations apply to prediction markets in many jurisdictions
Required Primitives: Outcome oracles, reputation systems, information aggregation

Name: Democratic Funding Mechanisms
Description: Quadratic funding, retroactive public goods funding, and novel mechanisms for allocating resources to public goods without centralized decision-making.
Key Implementations: Gitcoin, Optimism RetroPGF, Octant, Hypercerts
Key Institutional Players: Ethereum Foundation, Optimism Collective, Protocol Labs
Regulatory Context: Grant-making frameworks, charitable giving regulations vary
Required Primitives: Sybil resistance, quadratic voting, impact measurement

Name: Oracle Networks
Description: Decentralized data feeds connecting blockchains to real-world information.
Key Implementations: Pyth, Chronicle, RedStone, Chainlink

Name: Cross-Chain Infrastructure
Description: Cross-chain messaging and bridging for blockchain interoperability.
Key Implementations: LayerZero, Axelar, Wormhole, CoW Protocol, UniswapX
Projects: LayerZero (https://www.notion.so/LayerZero-2fc06d2570f281da88eff4e0db118836?pvs=21), Axelar (https://www.notion.so/Axelar-2fc06d2570f2814bb7b9e4b9f8f0c40c?pvs=21), Wormhole (https://www.notion.so/Wormhole-2fc06d2570f281b4bd86f109d1bd95d7?pvs=21), CoW Protocol (https://www.notion.so/CoW-Protocol-2fc06d2570f281a2a2dac6f59850d4ae?pvs=21), UniswapX (https://www.notion.so/UniswapX-2fc06d2570f281fea106d0369003abc1?pvs=21), OriginTrail (https://www.notion.so/OriginTrail-2ff06d2570f28153801fd05ab77fc084?pvs=21), peaq Network (https://www.notion.so/peaq-Network-2ff06d2570f281f5a38be360efbcaf11?pvs=21), IoTeX (https://www.notion.so/IoTeX-2ff06d2570f281768ce0fe7c3db63ea8?pvs=21)

Name: Data Availability & Storage
Description: Modular data availability layers and decentralized storage for blockchain scalability.
Key Implementations: Celestia, EigenDA, Avail, Filecoin, Arweave, The Graph
Projects: Celestia (https://www.notion.so/Celestia-2fc06d2570f28145b73dd9e4135cab9d?pvs=21), Filecoin (https://www.notion.so/Filecoin-2fc06d2570f281e28d21fa3cd66cc75b?pvs=21), Arweave (https://www.notion.so/Arweave-2fc06d2570f2810c805dd43c62676c7b?pvs=21), EigenDA (https://www.notion.so/EigenDA-2fc06d2570f281198493e2e19a44d028?pvs=21), Avail (https://www.notion.so/Avail-2fc06d2570f281039d29e69315d74ac4?pvs=21), The Graph (https://www.notion.so/The-Graph-2fc06d2570f28134888afc7c0571f7dd?pvs=21)

Name: Streaming & Treasury
Description: Token streaming protocols and programmable treasury management.
Key Implementations: Sablier, Superfluid, Llamapay
